author: schone_wizard
content: so why does ``--mnemonic-password`` exists on ``existing-mnemonic`` but not in ``new-mnemonic``

author: hsiaowei
content:
<@489217181104734219>
The `new-mnemonic` command uses default empty  `mnemonic_password` (`mnemonic_password=''`).

But if you have generated the mnemonic and keys with other tools and have set the `mnemonic_password`, this flag is for setting it with `existing-mnemonic` command.

content: why are some deposits running out of gas? https://etherscan.io/tx/0xf59845b616b900b259291aa58422add747ec5235d9118e218add75af82003a81

author: sky.cactus
content:
<@!386151184869752834> My guess is because of the height loop.  If you estimate gas and then state changes such that you end up deeper once mined the transaction will end up costing more at mine time:
```
        for (uint height = 0; height < DEPOSIT_CONTRACT_TREE_DEPTH; height++) {
            if ((size & 1) == 1) {
                branch[height] = node;
                return;
            }
            node = sha256(abi.encodePacked(branch[height], node));
            size /= 2;
        }
```
